info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 06 at 9:17PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Madison, northern Haywood and west central Buncombe Counties through 945 PM EDT... At 917 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 14 miles north of Waynesville, or near Smoky Mountains-Cataloochee, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Smoky Mountains-Cataloochee, Smoky Mountains-Big Creek, Smoky Mountains-Balsam Mountain, Cove Creek, Luck, Fines Creek and Spring Creek. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
